channel.title: Lack of communication
channel.description:
I understand that this thread may well be locked. Opinions here are my own.
I wish to raise the issue of the lack of communication of Adminstraitors with the members of this community. Admins, Global Mods, Sectional Mods, friends across the forum, first of all let me tell you that in my opinion you guys are doing an excellent job. I would be first to compliment you on your skills of handling threads, spambots, trollers etc. Nothing in my mind questions your authority or your competence.
However, you often leave members in the dark regarding updates to the forum. For example, since december in the Official News posts, a topic regarding "No more server basics" has been bumped continuously. 2 months later, no action has been taken and nobody here has a clue if this rule is being applied or not.
Another example is that a while back, a member suggested a request section since the takedown of many files and the flop of Megaupload. At the time, Taharok responded enthusiastically. Nothing was ever followed through.
Rules are not being updated. I have messaged Taharok about this before with no reply. I feel I should make it a public post and see what you guys have to say about feeling left in the dark.

item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:40, topic:491236”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=609470.msg4234596#msg4234596 date=1361488578]

• I don’t think we need a request section? What exactly would you be requesting? We have graphics requests, model requests, mostly anything you need for servers/clients can be found with search.
[/quote]This is not the case. A request section would be extremely handy because when you search for something old, usually what comes up is a topic with a dead link. Requesting means someone who has it can upload it for you. A good example of this would be the Project Annihilation server. It was requested by tons of people but was unavailable until someone finally re-uploaded it.

A requests board could come in handy but again, we’d need some moderators for it. It’d have a lot of the younger side of the community in there who aren’t quite as mature as the main part of the community so there would be some serious flaming/unnecessary spam and I could even see malware being uploaded.

Which is why we add the additional moderators who would check all downloads. Maybe we could go even as far as all posts must be approved, which will add a lot of over head…[/quote]

Moderating posts in the downloads section would be a massive pain for moderators. A lot of topics are created there daily, so you’d need a fair bit of man-power for it. I think the negatives outweigh the benefits for this idea in my opinion…

item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I completely agree with the lack of communication, but Tom covered just about every point needing to be covered.

Here are my two cents (which are just thoughts):

• We should have sectional moderators in the RS2 section, not only for rule breaking but to give decent feedback to the members of this community. It’s always nice when you see a moderator telling you did a good job.

• I think a new active admin should be looked into.

• We the staff are trying to meet up more frequently so things will actually get done here.

• I’ve talked to Taharok about the suggestions board, but he said he’d need a substantial amount of time to not only figure what’s wrong, but to fix it. The suggestions board was a great way to spread ideas.

• I don’t think we need a request section? What exactly would you be requesting? We have graphics requests, model requests, mostly anything you need for servers/clients can be found with search.

• And we still have Christmas pikas.
